work.name: W.I.Portfolio
work.description: My forever work in progress portfolio website.

work.name: iBuy Auctions
work.description: An auction site built using PHP/MySQL.

work.name: MyNorthampton
work.description: Personal project that overhauled the University of Northampton Student Portal (Extranet). This was achieved through improved RWD utilising CSS Grid with appropriate fallbacks for legacy browsers. The project's success was measured through the use of Google Lighthouse.

work.name: The New Web Times
work.description: The New Web Times is newspaper website created for a first-year university assignment. This static website demonstrates a series of web-based skills such as RWD, Semantic Markup and the basics of a PWA.

work.name: Arrow Shooter Game
work.description: A bird's-eye view, arrow-shooting game built using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

work.name: Total Engineering & Welding
work.description: A mobile-first, responsive brochure-style website using modern CSS layout tools to provide my client with a platform to advertise their business.

work.name: Brad Lovejoy Homepage
work.description: A single-page, static personal website for a client to replace their rather dull and plain-looking parking page previously in place.

work.name: Barclaycard Challenge 2019
work.description: Our team's (winning) submission for the Barclaycard Challenge 2019 - A artwork e-commerce website utilising PHP & MySQL implementing Barclaycard's payment technology.

work.name: Yelp Camp
work.description: YelpCamp is a project in which I follow along w/ Colt Steele and his Web Developer Bootcamp course available on Udemy. The main project of the course is YelpCamp - a website designed to showcase various campsites across the United States.

work.name: RGB Colour Game
work.description: A Small Client-Side JavaScript Game. Just Guess the Correct Colour.

work.description: A Small Client-Side JavaScript Game. Just Guess the Correct Colour.

work.name: Patatap Recreation
work.description: Utilising JavaScript libraries to recreate a simplified version of Patatap
